info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 17 at 6:32AM CDT until June 17 at 8:00AM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 AM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN MARION AND SOUTHEASTERN WASHINGTON COUNTIES... At 632 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Altamont to near Salem, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Centralia, Nashville, Wamac, Irvington, Ashley, Omega, Stephen Forbes Station, Helm, Posen, Beaucoup, Iuka, Richview, Oakdale, Radom, Kell, Du Bois, Walnut Hill, Cartter, Cordes and Huegely. This includes the following highways... Interstate 57 in Illinois near exit 109. Interstate 64 in Illinois near exit 61. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. To report severe weather contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in St Louis.
